greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Coefficient triangle of the numerators of the (n-th convergents to) the continued fraction 1/(w+2/(w+3/(w+4/... .
comment: Equivalence to the recurrence formula needs formal proof. This C.F. converges to 0.525135276160981.. for w=1. A conjecture by Ramanujan puts this equal to -1+1/(Sqrt[E Pi/2]-Sum[1/(2k-1)!!,{k,1,Infinity}]. Row sums equal A059480.
formula: b[0]=1; b[1]=w; b[n] = w b[n-1]+(n+1) b[n-2] (conjecture).
mathematica: Table[ CoefficientList[ Numerator[ Together[ Fold[ #2/(w+#1) &, Infinity, Reverse @ Table[ k, {k, 1, n} ] ] ] ], w ], {n, 2, 16} ] or equivalently Clear[ b ]; b[ 0 ]=1; b[ 1 ]=w; b[ n_ ]:=b[ n ] = w b[ n-1 ]+(n+1) b[ n-2 ]; Table[ CoefficientList[ b[ k ]//Expand, w ], {k, 0, 14} ]
results.author: _Wouter Meeussen_, Aug 08 2010
